meanings.definition: To strip of clothing or covering.
meanings.sent1: She quickly devests before jumping into the pool.
meanings.sent2: The baby devests before getting a bath.
meanings.sent3: The magician devests to reveal a surprise costume underneath.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar devests its cocoon to emerge as a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the character dramatically devests to symbolize vulnerability.

meanings.definition: To deprive of possessions or rights.
meanings.sent1: The thief devests the shop of valuable items.
meanings.sent2: The unjust ruler devests the people of their freedom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel devests the bird feeder of all its seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm devests the trees of their leaves, leaving them bare.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer devests the hero of his magical powers.
